comments.author: mk4
comments.body: Every time I dig slightly deep into trading discussions, this book almost always gets mentioned: "The Mental Game of Trading" by Jared Tendler. Can't vouch for it though because I haven't read it nor am interested in day trading. I'm more of a fundamental trader myself!

comments.author: Oshosondy
comments.body: Quote from: Lustful on June 29, 2023, 05:33:22 AMi'am looking for your recommendation on some essential books on how to trade/trading strategies (preferably on day trading)Read those books that other have mentioned already. But the strategy to use in trading that is most important are:The use of very little amount of you your money to trader. Trading is very risky. First see it as gambling until you make money from it frequently. If you still lose, see it as something dangerous. Do not leverage or at least using low leverage. If you use leverage more than 5x for bitcoin, it is getting too high. For a better and convenient trading, even use no leverage at all. Trade with good coins like bitcoin. Some good trader will keep on losing just because of the shitcoins they are using to trade.Learn how to use indicators and learn about fundamental analyses too.Discipline yourself. Do not be addicted. Do not be greedy. Overcome emotion. These are very important.

comments.author: Issa56
comments.body: Quote from: Lustful on June 29, 2023, 05:33:22 AMHello everyone , I'am a beginner on crypto trading and i'am looking for your recommendation on some essential books on how to trade/trading strategies (preferably on day trading), any of your recommendations would help, thank you.Books recommended above are enough to teach you about trading, but you can also visit YouTube and watch some tutorial videos on how to trade, but videos you see on YouTube might be talking about profits alone, and in trading, their is always profit and lose, but make sure your profit is more than your lose. You should know that its not all about watching videos and reading books, you have to put everything in practice, and you have to start with little amount you know if you lose it wont affect you. Don't think because you have watched different videos and you will think you know everything already, and you will end up starting with big amount of money, its not done like that, you have to start practicing gradually and you will develop your own strategy, everyone one is having strategy that works for them.

comments.body: Quote from: Lustful on June 29, 2023, 05:33:22 AMHello everyone , I'am a beginner on crypto trading and i'am looking for your recommendation on some essential books on how to trade/trading strategies (preferably on day trading), any of your recommendations would help, thank you.The ultimate question is that will a book impact you more than your own experience? comments.author: Litzki1990
comments.body: Above many people have shared you some good quality authors and book names so I didn't share the book names but I want to suggest you something different. In addition to learning about trading from the book, you will try to gain a trading experience by depositing a small amount of money into a good quality exchange account with some ideas from your book. And if you have any free time then you can browse online about trading related topics. And you will get various videos related to trading on different social media, keep following them. Hope you can become a good trader with the ideas of the book as well as practical experience and various videos from social media.
